title: Putin orders army to eject last Ukrainian troops from Russian territory
Fear and resignation after ‘world’s most powerful company’ pays Trump a $100 billion ‘protection fee’
Private equity is heading for a shake-up, experts say: 'This market actually is a good reset'
description: "You need to have your private markets beating your public market," Gaia Investment Partners' Serena Tan said.

title: Putin wants direct White House talks before Ukraine ceasefire, but says he is open to deal in principle
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin thanked U.S. President Donald Trump for giving "so much attention" to the prospect of a Russia-Ukraine deal.

title: Putin sets out conditions for Ukraine ceasefire
description: The Russian president agrees fighting must end, but calls for the removal of the "root causes" of the crisis.

title: Is Putin ready for a ceasefire or playing for time?
description: Russia is ready for a halt in fighting, says Vladimir Putin, but he says there are "nuances".

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Ex-Philippines President's First World Court Appearance Set For Today
description: Rodrigo Duterte's first appearance at the International Criminal Court has been set for Friday, the court said, as the former Philippines president faces crimes against humanity charges over his deadly war on drugs.

title: Trump Says He Still Has Good Relations With North Korea's Kim Jong Un
description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he still has a good relationship with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, with whom he held several summits during his first term, and referred to North Korea once again as a "nuclear power."

title: Inside a Mexican cartel ‘extermination’ camp: Ovens, shoes and teeth
description: A civilian search group found a gruesome site near Guadalajara, sparking outrage as authorities had raided the area months earlier but did not uncover the graves.
author: Mary Beth Sheridan

title: Trump’s trade war, rhetoric put his ambassador picks in tough spot
description: Worsening relations with three of the United States’ biggest trading partners dominated a Senate hearing for the would-be U.S. ambassadors to Canada, Mexico and Japan.
author: Abigail Hauslohner

title: Putin Stops Far Short of Agreeing to a Cease-Fire, and Adds Tough Conditions
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said the Russian leader had no desire to end the war, proposing conditions that made a truce unattainable.
author: The New York Times

title: Europe Expected a Transactional Trump. It Got Something Else.
description: Europe had been banking on a United States that wanted to make a deal on tariffs and trade. With little progress in that direction, it’s reluctantly starting to hit back.
author: Jeanna Smialek

title: Senate Democrats signal plans to advance GOP bill to avoid a government shutdown - NPR
description: Senate Democrats signal plans to advance GOP bill to avoid a government shutdown  NPROpinion | Chuck Schumer: Why Democrats Must Not Allow the Government to Shut Down  The New York TimesSchumer backs down on fight against GOP’s government funding bill as Democrats face reckoning over Trump strategy  CNNDemocrats to decide: Shut down government or side with Trump  The Washington PostSchumer backs GOP funding bill, unwilling to risk government shutdown  The Associated Press

title: Trump Administration Live Updates: Judge Orders Thousands of Federal Workers Reinstated - The New York Times
description: Trump Administration Live Updates: Judge Orders Thousands of Federal Workers Reinstated  The New York TimesJudge orders Trump administration to reinstate thousands of fired employees at VA, Defense Department and other agencies  CNNJudge orders thousands of federal workers reinstated; slams ‘sham’ government declaration  ABC NewsJudge orders Trump admin to reinstate probationary workers fired at 6 agencies  Fox NewsThousands of fired federal workers must be offered reinstatement, a judge rules  NPR

title: Trump’s ‘drill, baby, drill’ agenda could keep the world hooked on oil and gas
description: The US president is making energy deals with Japan and Ukraine, and in Africa has even touted resurrecting coalDonald Trump’s repeated mantra of “drill, baby, drill” demands that more oil and gas be extracted in the United States, but the president has set his sights on an even broader goal: keeping the world hooked on planet-heating fossil fuels for as long as possible.In deals being formulated with countries such as Japan and Ukraine, Trump is using US leverage in tariffs and military aid to bolster the flow of oil and gas around the world. In Africa, his administration has even touted the resurrection of coal, the dirtiest of all fossil fuels, to bring energy to the continent. Continue reading...
author: Oliver Milman and Dharna Noor

title: Biased laws and poverty driving huge rise in female prisoners – report
description: First such study finds laws on abortion, debt and dress help increase rate of women being jailed twice as fast as for menPoverty, abuse and discriminatory laws are driving a huge rise in the number of women in prison globally, according to a new report.With the rise of the far right and an international backlash against women’s rights, the research said there was a risk that laws would increasingly be used to target women, forcing more behind bars. Continue reading...
author: Sarah Johnson

title: Second shooting at Tesla dealership in Oregon amid rising attacks on company showrooms across US
description: A Tesla dealership in Tigard, Oregon, was hit by gunfire for the second time in a week, causing significant damage but no injuries. Investigations involve federal agencies, including the FBI and ATF. The attacks come as hostility towards Tesla and CEO Elon Musk increases, partly due to his role in the Trump administration's new department.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Facing government shutdown threat, Senate Democrat leader Chuck Schumer announces support for GoP funding bill
author: TOI World Desk
